message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.DL 

This paper discusses the use of natural language processing (NLP) neural network architectures for automated essay scoring (AES), which falls under the category of computational linguistics (cs.CL). The paper also compares two powerful language models, BERT and XLNet, which are commonly used in deep learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) research. Additionally, the paper discusses the advantages of transformer architectures over traditional recurrent neural network architectures, which is a topic of interest in deep learning (cs.DL) research. Finally, the paper compares the results with more traditional methods, such as bag of words (BOW) and long short term memory (LSTM) networks, which are commonly used in information retrieval (cs.IR) and deep learning (cs.DL) research.
